Reviews.Title: “A tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: rlv640
Reviews.Content: This Aladdin Hotel was definitely the WORST hotel I´ve ever seen in my life. I am from a developing country (Brazil), and I´ve never seen in my country such a bad place to stay on. It is as SHAME that the New York department of something-related-matter did not close down this place. I´ve booked a room at this tourist trap in 2000 through my travel agent, and I regretted the most when I came from 42th street station and found this awful, dreadful hotel. The red-and-blue carpet in the entrance was smelling bad, the room was dirty and noisy, the window did not have a lock, the bathroom was terrible. I cannot believe that such a hole still exists in a beautiful city like New York. My fellow Brazilians: DO NOT GO TO ALADDIN HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place”
Reviews.Author: dfsaklfdhsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a shelter. It is disgustingly dirty and there are scary people running around at all hours of the night. The couple staying in the room next to us got into a fight and we could hear the man beating the woman. There were screams and horrible noises coming from the next room and the police were called. Staying in this hotel was a horrible experience- it is filthy and dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: vtnz
Reviews.Content: This is not even comparable to YHA. Far from it! Can't close the windows at night. Spider web in every corner of the room. Flooded bathroom and toilets. If you want to ruin your holiday, this will definitely fulfill it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All 6 us my friends and I stayed in one big room. We laughed we dranked and partied. The only thing we had to adapt to for that week was the shared bathroom. But it was New York during spring break, we understood. So no big deal. We're from Chicago, not that much difference.

Reviews.Title: “Cool for young”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel during the morning. I was handed the keys to my room, wich I knew was a shared room. I open the door, still carrying my luggage and what I see: to half naked 25 years young girls. I... am a male. So what I did not know, was that the room was shared by members of both genders. I played it as if nothing important had happened, said "hi", entered and unloaded my bags, facing opposite to them. When I was finished, we stroke conversation. Bottom line: we got to be friends and hanged out in Manhattan for over a week. They were from Germany. I am from Argentina. For 24 bucks a night, it was a pretty good deal. If you are young and just looking for a place to crash and meet young people, take this place. Best.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this hotel hasn't been closed down. I stayed there on my second visit to New York a few years ago but after two horrendous nights checked out and, thanks to a friendly, sympathetic New Yorker, found somewhere equally central, inexpensive, spotlessly clean and welcoming (Portland Square Hotel - stay there instead!) The lift at The Aladdin wouldn't work so we had to climb up 5 flights of stone stairs with heavy cases. The room had 2 army-style camp beds with one sheet, one thin, rough, brown blanket and one pillow. All the bedding was disgusting and during the night some strange guy just walked into our room - had some kind of communal key to all rooms! I spent the remainder of the night sitting against the door, too worried to sleep. The hotel isn't just for tourists it also houses permanent NYC residents who appear to be deranged. A door down the corridor had a hand-written sign on it saying "Anyone Who Knocks Dies" with a picture of a gun and a skull. The communal shower-room (used by both sexes)seemed to be shared between about 10 rooms and was the worst case scenario of overflowing toilets / blocked plugs so you had to paddle through brown water to get to a sink. The reception are obviously used to complaints because when you complain they just shrug / don't react. Apart from one guy at reception, no staff spoke English - had to communicate through sign-language! Another reviewer has written it would be better to stay at the station - I said so myself at the time! I love travelling and have stayed happily in very basic youth hostels / budget hotels and wasn't expecting The Ritz. I was hoping The Aladdin would be a clean, functional base from which to explore New York - literally somewhere to sleep and wash. You can't sleep or wash there - it's dangerous and disgusting - the kind of place you dread going back to. New York is fantastic - one of the best cities in the world - don't let The Aladdin ruin it for you.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed here in summer 2001 whilst at uni - perhaps because we were students then, and didn't expect much, we weren't disappointed. I don't remember any mice, I just remember the room being basic but more than adquate, the staff being helpful and the atmosphere in the place being very good. Yes it's not luxury but what can you expect for the cheapness! Great location ... very slow lift and wish there had have been more showers to a better standard, but apart from that it was fine for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived here with my son in 2001 and he was 7 at the time. Had booked a couple of nights here as part of my round the world trip. We had arrived from the UK and this was our first destination of the year. I agree with a previous poster,,, if you expect nothing then you are not disappointed - after all this is only a short distance from 42nd Street in the heart of New York and was very Cheap!!! My only concern was that my son was very excited and started to jump on the bed, the window sill was at the same level and I had visions of him plummeting to the concrete pavement six floors below. So I did what all mums would do in that situation, shut the window, told him not to jump and took care of it. If I could have afforded the Hilton then I would have spent more time in the room - but we were in New York and there was loads to do. When you have exhausted yourself after a full day, had a shower to wash of the grime of the city who cares!! p.s. I have never had an en-suite at home, so a few paces to the bathroom did not kill either of us!

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited NY in September 2000. I booked a triple room via the Internet for 10 days. When I arrived the had lost my reservation. Fortunately I had a copu of the email and the find me a room. Room was awful. 3 bunk bad, no linens. The room smelled very bad. We tryed to open the window but we closed it immediately. There was a fast food or something like this below and the smell outside was worst than inside. Accordin with the reservation, bathroom must have been semi-private but... there was a bathroom (2 wc, 1 shower and 2 sink if I remember right) for men and women. My Mum and I had a psycological "block" and weren't able to ---- for a day and half. In the night we met mice in the corridor. Elevator worked very bad and we walked up and down (we were at 5th floor) for making phone calls to friends who were helping us finding a better hotel. We got lines at 10pm after telling to the staff I called the police! We didn't sleep in the night and we kept luggage on the top of the bed. We didn't open luggage. The day after we went out at 5am lookign for a better place and we find one a few blocks form this terrible place at 10$ more for night.

Reviews.Title: “Should be closed down!!”
Reviews.Author: liz_c
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever been in. My husband surprised me with a trip to NY a few years back. He booked 1 night here. We drove past the place like 5 times, the sign was so small. When we got into the room, all I could do was cry. It was sloppily painted flourescent green, the window was open and did not have a screen in it, the place was filthy, and the topper was there was no bathroom in the room. There was a disgusting community bathroom down the hall. My husband demanded our money back and we found another place that still wasn't up to par, but was by far much better. (I don't recall the name of the 2nd hotel). This place should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Hotel I have ever seen, was conned in to booking as was told that the room we had booked had en suite facilities.......How wrong that was!NOt even a sink in the room, dirty bed sheets, staff that frankly couldnt care less about anything.Please DONT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we've ever been. This place ruined my wife's first visit of NY. When we saw the room (expensive because we took a single room with a sink in the room...) my wife started to cry, everything was dirty (we couldn't see through the windows because it was so dirty, walls and shelves dirty) and no sink in the room, we didn't unpack our bags (the only way to keep our clothes clean). The showers and toilets were disgusting, we had to wake up at 05h00 am in order to be the first to take a shower to have a "clean" place. During the nights we had the visit of mice IN the room. When we mentioned this at the reception, they said : "it is normal in NY sir" ... The sheets and the pillows had stains. During our stay we left this place early in the morning to come back as late as possible. My wife was very disappointed because this place broke her "American dream". The city is wonderful, but DO NOT go in this rathole.

Reviews.Title: “beware!”
Reviews.Author: Giselle74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May 2000. It was without a doubt the most repulsive dive I have ever stayed in. There was no air conditioning or screens on the windows. I was put in a room with two male guests (i am female) without being consulted. They seemed to have no problem getting a prostitute in past the check-in desk at 3 a.m. I dont know if they have improved since then but please take my advice and STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Your worse nightmare”
Reviews.Author: alionka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our second trip to NYC Thanksgiving Weekend 2000. This is by far the worse hotel I am ever stayed in my life. We paid $110 for a room with 4 bunk beds. Unfortunately we didnt read any reviews prior to booking. The run-down lobby should have been a dead give away that this was the wrong place to stay. But unfortunately by the time we saw the room it was too late to get our money back. I cant believe we found this place in the Official NYC Guide (Luckily it is no longer listed there). Would have never imaged a place like this could exist just blocks from Times Square. The odor in the halls and room was beyond words. There were mice in the room. The shared bathroom was hideous. We were repulsed and could not take a shower. This place ruined out trip. My friends got a bad first impression. This hotel should be closed down! Would not stay here even if it were for free!

HotelInfo.Name: The Aladdin
HotelInfo.Address: 317 West 45th Street, New York City, NY 10036
